div1.p: Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus Pet.
Anna Vine vs. Sheldon Jackson et al. Def.
Filed in the Day of March 1885
Andrew F. Lewis. Clerk
M. P. Burn. Atty.
In the United States District Court. District of Alaska
Petition for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Anna Vine Pet. vs. Sheldon Jackson, Alonzo E. Austin and Mrs McFarland, deft.

The complaintant Anna Vine, subject by marriage of her majest, Queen Victoria, Royal empress of India, for cause of compliance against the above named defendents: Sheldon Jackson, Alonzo E. Austin and MrsMcFarland deft ,complain as follows:

That one Emma Hamilton, a female minor child, about thirteen (13) years of age in unlawfully held in what is generally known as the Sheldon Jackson Institute - certain house on houses, situate in the town of Sitka Alaska, against her own free will or on that of her natural guardian the said Anna ine, Plaintiff afore named.
Wherefore your petitioner prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus directed to M. C. Hellyer United States Marshal for the District of Alaska

commanding him to have the body of the said Ema Hamilton, named child - before the district judge for said judicial district, forthwith, that inquiry may be made, why and wherefore the said Emma Hamilton, minor, in restrained of her liberty, and further that she be allowed, provided, she be a person of good mind as recognized by law - to maker for election, and for all and such further relief as may be allowed by your honor, in the premise.
M. P. Bevy
Atty for Complaint
District of Alaska Town of Sitka

Anna Vine Plaintiff in the above cause being first duly sworn says that she is the natural guardian of Emma Hamilton - that the said Emma Hamilton was given her by a deceased relative the said childs mother to raise - that she is able to provide for the girl and plennish her with all the necessary comforts of life and duration and that she is desirous of taking her to

house at Victoria British Columbia, and that was the sake and only reason of her coming to Sitka Alaska. Further that the U.S. Mail Steamer departs on the 12 day of March 1885 on the return trip to her home at Victoria and for next reason only affiant preys his to issue a writ rethinkable forthwith for the said Emma Hamilton.
Annavine, her mark
Witness Signature
Jon Carroll
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 11 day of March 1885.
Andrew T. Lewis, Clerk.
